channel.title: Comments on: Tuples in JavaScript
channel.description: On programming and text editing. Addicted to lisps.

item.title: By: Deepu Mohan Puthrote
item.dc:creator: Deepu Mohan Puthrote
item.content:encoded:
What do you think about using array destructing instead?

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Destructuring_assignment

const [x, y, z] = [30, 40, 50];

item.title: By: pixelBender67
item.dc:creator: pixelBender67
item.description: This is cool, python uses tuples as well
item.content:encoded: This is cool, python uses tuples as well

item.title: By: Oliver Caldwell
item.dc:creator: Oliver Caldwell
item.description: Just copying the reply I sent to Jan so you get a notification: Done! Although I have simplified it and made it a lot more tuple-esc. Still does the same thing though! https://github.com/Wolfy87/tuple

item.title: By: Ege
item.dc:creator: Ege
item.description: With me, I guess there are at least two people, which means there is at least a bit of interest =)
item.content:encoded: With me, I guess there are at least two people, which means there is at least a bit of interest =)

item.title: By: Oliver Caldwell
item.dc:creator: Oliver Caldwell
item.description:
I would quite like to turn this into a full project too. With tests and exposure through AMD and CommonJS. As long as there's a bit of interest and it's not something only I would use then I would be happy to publish it.
I'll might even start tonight. Thanks for the vote!
item.content:encoded:
I would quite like to turn this into a full project too. With tests and exposure through AMD and CommonJS. As long as there’s a bit of interest and it’s not something only I would use then I would be happy to publish it.

I’ll might even start tonight. Thanks for the vote!
